results.title: At Whistling Straits, Golfers Will Have to Go Against the Grains
results.abstract: P.G.A. Championship officials have said that, as in 2010, when Dustin Johnson was assessed a controversial penalty, the roughly 1,000 sand patches strewn about the property are again bunkers.

multimedia.caption: Dustin Johnson hitting out of a bunker on No. 18 at the 2010 P.G.A. Championship at Whistling Straits, where he was assessed a two-stroke penalty.
Dustin Johnson hitting out of a bunker on No. 18 at the 2010 P.G.A. Championship at Whistling Straits, where he was assessed a two-stroke penalty.
Dustin Johnson hitting out of a bunker on No. 18 at the 2010 P.G.A. Championship at Whistling Straits, where he was assessed a two-stroke penalty.
Dustin Johnson hitting out of a bunker on No. 18 at the 2010 P.G.A. Championship at Whistling Straits, where he was assessed a two-stroke penalty.

results.title: Rory McIlroy Says He’s ‘100 Percent’ for P.G.A. Championship
results.abstract: McIlroy, who ruptured ankle ligaments while playing soccer on July 4, said he would tee off in a much-anticipated Thursday grouping with Jordan Spieth and Zach Johnson.

multimedia.caption: Rory McIlroy after a practice round Monday. McIlroy, the world No. 1, missed the Scottish Open, the British Open and the Bridgestone Invitational.
Rory McIlroy after a practice round Monday. McIlroy, the world No. 1, missed the Scottish Open, the British Open and the Bridgestone Invitational.

results.title: Australian Brothers Cherish Their Reunion at P.G.A. Championship
results.abstract: In the P.G.A. Championship, Matt Jones, who has three top-10 finishes on the tour this year, will be joined by Brett Jones, a club pro in New Jersey.

multimedia.caption: Matt Jones, at the British Open last month, will be joined at the P.G.A. Championship this week by his brother, Brett.
Matt Jones, at the British Open last month, will be joined at the P.G.A. Championship this week by his brother, Brett.

results.title: Mets Top Rockies as Michael Cuddyer Comes Off D.L., and Sits
results.abstract: While Cuddyer was out with a knee injury, the Mets acquired three veterans, and a top prospect earned their trust. So Cuddyer, even while earning $8.5 million this year, could become a bench player.

multimedia.caption: The Mets’ Michael Cuddyer, right, with the Rockies’ first-base coach, Eric Young, before the start of Monday’s game at Citi Field.
The Mets’ Michael Cuddyer, right, with the Rockies’ first-base coach, Eric Young, before the start of Monday’s game at Citi Field.

results.title: David Wright Looks Good in First Rehab Start
results.abstract: Wright, wearing his Mets helmet while playing in a game for the first time since April 14, went 1 for 3 with a walk as the designated hitter for Class A St. Lucie.

multimedia.caption: David Wright during the first inning Monday. He had completed five consecutive days of workouts in Port St. Lucie.

results.title: NBC Retains Rights to Premier League in Six-Year Deal
results.abstract: NBC, which has used English soccer to define its NBCSN cable network, made a deal worth about $1 billion, basically double the annual cost of NBC’s current contract.

multimedia.caption: NBCSN’s studios in Stamford, Conn., in 2013. Last season, the combined viewership of Premier League games on NBC and NBCSN climbed to an average of 479,000.
multimedia.copyright: Tim Clayton for The New York Times

results.title: Live and Kicking: Soccer Games to Watch This Week
results.abstract: Barcelona’s busy, Bayern kicks off, and Chelsea battles Manchester City. The soccer editor Andrew Das tells you what to watch.

results.title: Gear Dispute Costs Nick Symmonds a Trip to Track Worlds
results.abstract: A top 800-meter runner has refused to sign a document that requires American athletes to wear Nike gear at official team functions at the world championships, which begin Aug. 22 in Beijing.

multimedia.caption: Nick Symmonds winning the 800 meters at the United States track and field championships in Eugene, Ore., in June.
Nick Symmonds winning the 800 meters at the United States track and field championships in Eugene, Ore., in June.
Nick Symmonds winning the 800 meters at the United States track and field championships in Eugene, Ore., in June.
Nick Symmonds winning the 800 meters at the United States track and field championships in Eugene, Ore., in June.

results.title: Los Angeles Is a Frugal, if Not Flashy, Option for the 2024 Games
results.abstract: With some of the infrastructure already in place and ready to be reused, Los Angeles is considered the most likely American candidate to host the 2024 Olympics following the collapse of Boston’s bid.

multimedia.caption: The Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum, built for the 1932 Olympics and used again as the host stadium in 1984.
The Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum, built for the 1932 Olympics and used again as the host stadium in 1984.
The Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum, built for the 1932 Olympics and used again as the host stadium in 1984.
The Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum, built for the 1932 Olympics and used again as the host stadium in 1984.

results.title: Marin Cilic Struggles to Get Back Into Zone After U.S. Open Success
results.abstract: As the No. 14 seed last year, Cilic claimed his first Grand Slam title. But since then, he has been bothered by a shoulder injury and has yet to reach the final of any tournament.

multimedia.caption: Marin Cilic playing last week in the Citi Open, where he lost in the semifinals. He has not reached a final since his United States Open win.
Marin Cilic playing last week in the Citi Open, where he lost in the semifinals. He has not reached a final since his United States Open win.

Marin Cilic playing last week in the Citi Open, where he lost in the semifinals. He has not reached a final since his United States Open win.

results.title: Blue Jays’ Record Catches Up to Expectations
results.abstract: Toronto, which had a losing record on July 29, made some significant acquisitions. But the team’s run differential indicated that a powerful team was waiting to emerge all along.

multimedia.caption: Troy Tulowitzki, left, and Dioner Navarro after Navarro homered on July 30, during Tulowitzki’s Toronto debut.
Troy Tulowitzki, left, and Dioner Navarro after Navarro homered on July 30, during Tulowitzki’s Toronto debut.

results.title: The Jeter of Yankee Stadium Cameramen
results.abstract: To many fans at Yankee Stadium, Eric Capstick, 53, is as welcome a sight as a star player. His job is to shoot them in the stands for real-time display on the big screens.

multimedia.caption: Eric Capstick, a cameraman at Yankee Stadium, gets almost as much attention as the players.

results.title: 2 Sayreville Football Players Cleared of Serious Charges in Hazing Case
results.abstract: The players, both 17 at the time of the episode, had been charged with aggravated sexual contact and aggravated assault; they were found guilty of two disorderly persons charges.
results.byline: By ANDY NEWMAN and JASON GRANT
org_facet: Sayreville War Memorial High School (Sayreville, NJ)

multimedia.caption: Seven football players at Sayreville War Memorial High School were accused last fall of attacking freshmen in a locker room.

results.title: 2015 Fantasy Football: Quarterback Preview and Rankings
results.abstract: The quarterback position is deep once again, but knowing where to pick one could make all the difference on draft day.
results.byline: By JASON SABLICH and JUSTIN SABLICH

results.title: Gus Mortson, Defenseman Who Helped Toronto Win Four Stanley Cups, Dies at 90
results.abstract: Mortson teamed with Jim Thomson in a Maple Leafs pairing that was among the league’s toughest.

results.title: Buddy Baker, Winner of the 1980 Daytona 500, Dies at 74
results.abstract: Baker, Nascar’s “Gentle Giant,” was the first driver to exceed 200 miles per hour on a closed course.
org_facet: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing

multimedia.caption: Buddy Baker after winning the pole for the 1969 Daytona 500. He won the race in 1980.
Buddy Baker after winning the pole for the 1969 Daytona 500. He won the race in 1980.
Buddy Baker after winning the pole for the 1969 Daytona 500. He won the race in 1980.
Buddy Baker after winning the pole for the 1969 Daytona 500. He won the race in 1980.

results.title: Rangers Sign Center Jarret Stoll
results.abstract: Stoll, who won two Stanley Cups with the Los Angeles Kings, joined the Rangers a few months after he pleaded guilty in a felony cocaine case.

multimedia.caption: Jarret Stoll with the Kings last year. Stoll, 33, gives the Rangers a top face-off man and penalty killer.
Jarret Stoll with the Kings last year. Stoll, 33, gives the Rangers a top face-off man and penalty killer.
Jarret Stoll with the Kings last year. Stoll, 33, gives the Rangers a top face-off man and penalty killer.

results.title: Patriots Shake Up Their Quarterback Roster
results.abstract: New England released Matt Flynn, who had been on the nonfootball injury list, and signed Ryan Lindley, a former Cardinals quarterback, to be the third-stringer.

multimedia.caption: Matt Flynn in June. Ryan Lindley replaced him on Monday as New England’s third-string quarterback.
Matt Flynn in June. Ryan Lindley replaced him on Monday as New England’s third-string quarterback.
Matt Flynn in June. Ryan Lindley replaced him on Monday as New England’s third-string quarterback.
Matt Flynn in June. Ryan Lindley replaced him on Monday as New England’s third-string quarterback.

results.title: Government Explains Push for Lance Armstrong’s Medical Records
results.abstract: The government said the records from Armstrong’s 1996 cancer treatments could prove just how far he was willing to go to conceal performance-enhancing-drug use.

results.title: Officials Deny Dirty Water Made Rowers in Rio Sick
results.abstract: United States officials confirmed that 15 members of the team fell ill after the world junior championships but said that was not abnormal in international events.

results.title: Arena League Teams in Las Vegas and New Orleans Fold
results.abstract: A league announcement said the Las Vegas Outlaws and the New Orleans VooDoo had ceased operations. The decision leaves the league with 10 teams.

results.title: Frank Gifford, Star for the Giants and in Broadcast Booth, Dies at 84
results.abstract: Gifford was a Hall of Fame running back and receiver who personified the Giants’ glory years of the late 1950s and early ’60s and then became a mainstay on television.
results.byline: By RICHARD GOLDSTEIN and BRUCE WEBER

results.title: How 14 Indicted FIFA Officials Currently Stand
results.abstract: Updating the legal status of the soccer and sports marketing officials charged in the FIFA corruption case.

results.title: After Sydney Seau, Football Hall of Fame Policy Will Be Tested Again
results.abstract: By giving Sydney Seau an abbreviated forum to speak on behalf of her father, the Pro Football Hall of Fame showed the folly of an exclusionary policy for dead inductees.

multimedia.caption: Sydney Seau with her father's Hall of Fame bust at the Pro Football Hall of Fame induction ceremony in Canton, Ohio.
multimedia.copyright: Andrew Weber/USA Today Sports, via Reuters

results.title: Winning Mantra of ‘I’m Not Sick’ Propels Victoria Duval
results.abstract: Duval, then 18, received a diagnosis of Hodgkin’s lymphoma, a cancer of the lymphatic system, the day before her first qualifying match at Wimbledon. She stayed and played.

multimedia.caption: Victoria Duval, 19, last week in Bradenton, Fla. She learned that she had Hodgkin’s lymphoma in 2014. Thirteen months after her last match, she will compete this week at a tournament in Landisville, Pa.
multimedia.copyright: Melissa Lyttle for The New York Times

results.title: A Minor League Home Run King Without Major Fanfare
results.abstract: Mike Hessman, 37, who now sits alone atop the career home run list for the affiliated minor leagues, is thankful to have had brief chances in the major leagues.

multimedia.caption: Mike Hessman was feted by his Toledo Mud Hens teammates last week for setting the affiliated minor leagues’ career home run record.
Mike Hessman was feted by his Toledo Mud Hens teammates last week for setting the affiliated minor leagues’ career home run record.

results.title: Wanted: A Driver in Brooklyn. Must Use Care in Icy Conditions.
results.abstract: The Islanders are relocating to Barclays Center next season and need someone to operate the Zamboni, but the job is more complex than it sounds.

multimedia.caption: The key for the ice resurfacer used at Islanders games. The job of driving the machine is more complex than it sounds.

results.title: A Real Adventure: Sorting Out All the F.K.T.s (Fastest Known Times)
results.abstract: Peter Bakwin’s website is the closest thing that trail running and speed hiking have to a record book, making him the endurance genre’s de facto commissioner.

multimedia.caption: Scott Jurek on McAfee Knob on the Appalachian Trail in Virginia during his record-setting run this summer.

results.title: Sam Querrey Earns 1st-Round Win in Montreal
results.abstract: Sam Querrey got past Martin Klizan in straight sets 6-3, 6-3 in the first round of the Rogers Cup men's tournament on Monday.

results.title: Los Angeles Proposes $4.1B Budget if Olympic Candidate
results.abstract: If the city of Los Angeles becomes the U.S. candidate for the 2024 Olympics after Boston's recent drop from contention, the organizers' proposed budget for the Summer Games would be $4.1 billion plus a $400 million contingency, a senior adviser to Mayor Eric Garcetti said Monday.
